caption: Rachel K. Collier: Simplifying Creativity with Novation’s Launchkey MK4 and Ableton Live Lite
subCaption: Discover Rachel K. Collier’s approach to streamlined music making with Novation’s Launchkey MK4 & Ableton Live Lite.

caption: Made in Ableton Live: Jakob Rau
subCaption: See how producer and engineer Jakob Rau collaborates with friends – including Berlin-based singer-songwriter Lindy – and get a comprehensive look at his approach to arrangement and mixing.

caption: Jon Hopkins: No Comfort Without Discomfort
subCaption: An in-depth interview with Jon Hopkins as he breaks down and isolates component parts of his immersive album Ritual, plus discussion of his favorite hardware, software and Ableton Live features.

caption: Discover Advanced Reharmonizing Techniques with Live 12.1's Auto Shift
subCaption: Combine Auto Shift with Resonators to create this powerful reharmonizing Rack.

caption: Henrique J. Paris & RS Produções: Mapping Batida’s Heritage
subCaption: A look at the evolution of batida – an ever-evolving style of electronic music coming out of Portugal that fuses Angolan and other West African influences with sampling and beatmaking techniques. Plus, batida beatmakers RS Produções share a free selection of loops and beats.

caption: Alan Sparhawk: I Made This Beat
subCaption: Alan Sparhawk of US indie legends Low talks about branching out into uncharted electronic territory on his debut solo album White Roses, My God.

caption: Going Deeper into Sound: Eight Standout Features, Videos and Tutorials from 2024
subCaption: Wrap up 2024 by checking out some of our favorite tutorials, videos, and features from across the year, and head into 2025 with all the music-making inspiration you could wish for.

caption: Download the Live Set of Polygonia’s New Track “Neon Oracle”
subCaption: Munich-based artist Polygonia discusses the making of her new track, “Neon Oracle”, and her multidisciplinary approaches to music making.

caption: Ben Lukas Boysen: Overdoing It Just Right
subCaption: Erased Tapes artist Ben Lukas Boysen (aka Hecq) breaks down the gear, techniques and intention behind every track of his album Alta Ripa. Plus he shares the track “Quasar” as a free Ableton Live Project complete with audio stems.

caption: Ebonie Smith on the Difference Between Engineers and Producers
subCaption: Atlantic Records producer Ebonie Smith talks about the influence of cinema and the unique demands of working with poets and spoken-word artists.

caption: Make a Melodic House Track in 10 Minutes on Ableton Move
subCaption: See how LNA uses Move’s built-in microphone, effects, and parameter automation to create interesting ideas quickly.

caption: Making Practice Fun: Drumming on the Move with Rodi Kirk
subCaption: To become a better musician, practice is essential, but it doesn't have to be boring. Rodi Kirk shares tips on incorporating rudiments into your daily routine, making practice more enjoyable – plus, get some free lessons from Melodics.

caption: Berlioz: The Tetris Method of Jazz-House
subCaption: Jazz-house rising star Berlioz expounds on his production process, working with session musicians and balancing spontaneity with structure.

caption: Upsammy: Crossing Strange Meridians
subCaption: upsammy aka the Netherlands’ Thessa Torsig gives insights into the tools and processes she uses for her genre-defying electronic compositions. She also shares a selection of specially-crated audio loops, free to download.

caption: See What You Can Do With Live 12.1 – Plus What’s New for Push
subCaption: Check out Auto Shift, Drum Sampler and all of Live 12.1’s new additions – and what this latest update brings to Push.

caption: Chuck Sutton on Finding Your Voice with the Tools in Reach
subCaption: Chuck Sutton talks about the hidden potential in Live's native devices, problem solving leading to new ideas and using technical tools for creative results.

caption: Beat Breaking: How to Create a Jungle-Inspired Track on Ableton Move
subCaption: See how Side Brain builds a beat in under 20 minutes using Move's intuitive step sequencer, pads, and built-in effects.

caption: Your Move Questions, Answered
subCaption: Head of Product Johannes Russ answers the most popular questions about Move from the Ableton Community.

caption: Emily Hopkins Explores the Harp Through Pedals and Pick-Ups
subCaption: Harpist Emily Hopkins talks about her experimental approach to the harp, which she documents on her popular YouTube channel.
